definitions.definition: The upper portion of a page (or other) layout .
examples: If you reduce the header of this document, the body will fit onto a single page.

definitions.definition: Text , or other visual information, used to mark off a quantity of text, often titling or summarizing it.
examples: Your header is too long; "Local Cannibals" will suffice.

definitions.definition: Text, or other visual information, that goes at the top of a column of information in a table .
examples: That column should have the header "payment status".

definitions.definition: A font , text style, or typesetting used for any of the above.
examples: Parts of speech belong in a level-three header . Level-two headers are reserved for the name of the language.

definitions.definition: The first part of a file or record that describes its contents.
examples: The header includes an index, an identifier, and a pointer to the next entry.

definitions.definition: the first part of a packet or stream , often containing its address and descriptors.
examples: The encapsulation layer adds an eight-byte header and a two-byte trailer to each packet.

definitions.definition: A brick that is laid sideways (on its largest face), for example at the top of a wall or within the brickwork , with its smallest side showing (oriented so that that side is wider than it is tall).
examples: This wall has four header courses.

definitions.definition: A horizontal structural or finish piece over an opening.
A machine that separates and gathers the heads of grain etc.
examples: They fed the bale into the header .

definitions.definition: The act of hitting the ball with the head.
examples: His header for the goal followed a perfect corner kick.

definitions.definition: A headlong fall , jump or dive .
examples: The clown tripped over the other clown and took a header .

definitions.definition: A raised tank that supplies water at constant pressure, especially to a central heating and hot water system.
A pipe which connects several smaller pipes.
examples: Common practice is to use plastic pipes with iron headers .

definitions.definition: The rodeo performer who drives the steer toward the heeler to be tied .
One who puts a head on something.
A headcase ; a nutjob ( mentally unbalanced , unpredictable person ) .

main_definition: The upper portion of a page (or other) layout .

The rodeo performer who drives the steer toward the heeler to be tied .
